=Building !CyanogenMod for the Android Emulator=
==Getting repo==
Follow the steps [http://source.android.com/download here] to set up repo for your system

==Setting Up==
Create an empty directory to hold your working files:
{{{
$ mkdir mydroid
$ cd mydroid
}}}

Run repo init to bring down the 1.5r3 source. You must specify a URL for the manifest:
{{{
$ repo init -u git://android.git.kernel.org/platform/manifest.git -b android-1.5r3
}}}

Run:
{{{
$ repo sync
}}}

Go to cyanogen's github page and download local_manifest-4.0.xml
http://github.com/cyanogen/android/downloads

Place it in the .repo folder in the mydroid folder you created earlier and rename it local_manifest.xml

Run:
{{{
$ repo sync
}}}

==Building==
{{{
$ . build/envsetup.sh # notice the leading dot
$ lunch generic-eng
$ make
$ emulator& 
}}}

=Building !CyanogenMod for the HTC Dream=

==Getting repo==
Follow the steps [http://source.android.com/download here] to set up repo for your system

==Setting Up==
  #. Create an empty directory to hold your working files.
    {{{
    $ mkdir source
    $ cd source
    }}}
  #. Initialize repo to with the 1.5r3 manifest.
    {{{
    $ repo init -u git://android.git.kernel.org/platform/manifest.git -b android-1.5r3
    }}}
  #. Download [http://abstrakraft.org/android/local_manifest.xml local_manifest.xml].
    {{{
    $ cd .repo
    $ wget http://abstrakraft.org/android/local_manifest.xml
    $ cd ..
    }}}

==Downloading the Code==
  #. Sync the repository.  This step may take awhile.
    {{{
    $ repo sync
    }}}

==Download Proprietary Code==
  #. Plug your G1 via USB.
  #. Download the HTC G1 proprietary files.
    {{{
    $ cd vendor/htc/dream-open
    $ ./extract-files.sh
    }}}
  

==Building==
  #. Setup the environment.
    {{{
    $ source build/envsetup.sh
    $ lunch htc_dream-eng
    $ export ANDROID_JAVA_HOME=$JAVA_HOME
    }}}
  #. Compile
    {{{
    $ make
    }}}

==Current Issues==
This process does not yet build cm-kernel, and has not yet been tested on a device.
